videos.title: Blender Network Rendering (Hack) (English)
videos.description:
After running through too much impractical solutions , at last I found a very simple way to render scenes using command line and run blender in the background normally through remote desktop for the purpose of  on PC's that has old GPU's like server and BOXX machines 
it is more like a hack not an actual network rendering , but it works like charm! 
didn't try to make all machines to read the same file at the same time through network address , so I transfer file to read it locally on each computer.
if any one have solution the same way for Linux it will be great to mention it in the comments
Also I hope we have a proper network rendering solution in blender itself to render large static images by stitching like back-burner in 3ds max or crowd render add-on which requires blender to run , that means you will stumble upon  remote desktop or team-viewer (terrible in LAN connections) in turn won't work easily or won't work at all on older GPU's 
you can download it from here but you must sign-up to have your copy for free
https://www.crowd-render.com

Batch file Format 
copy what is below the line into .bat file you create on your PC
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender

blender -b "c:\Batch_render.blend" -a
